intro: Bupleurum polyactis, commonly known as the common valerian, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported calming and antispasmodic properties. Bupleurum polyactis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and meadows.
